summary: I can't with the people who say Jon should be pro-Targ because they think Ned was pro-targ when literally Ned said in AGoT that...
question: I can't with the people who say Jon should be pro-Targ because they think Ned was pro-targ when literally Ned said in AGoT that he never forgave Rhaeger.. "This he could never forgive, no more than he had forgiven Rhaeger." I think people need to realise that the reason Ned got mad when Robert said he wanted "To put an end to Targaryens" was because he thought killing Dany and her baby was wrong yes (1)
answer:
but MOST importantly because he wanted to protect JON who is his SISTER’s son. It’s all about Lyanna and Jon NOT about Targaryens. I would love to know what your opinion is on this subject. Sorry if I come off a bit strong I am really passionate lol (2)

Hi, anon!

I need to preface this with admitting that I don’t really know Ned very well, and that I don’t think I’ve ever seen anyone say this. So it’s not something I’ve given a lot of thought. But I’ll try answering!

Ned has no reason to think well of the T/rgaryens. But like most morally sound people, he thinks it’s wrong to murder pregnant teenage girls. And as someone who lost his teenage sister when she gave birth to a T/rg baby, and as someone who’s lied about that baby’s identity for the past decade and a half to protect him, it’s pretty damn personal for Ned. But it doesn’t mean he thinks T/rgs are swell.

That being said, I think Ned’s opinion is irrelevant, because it doesn’t necessarily inform the opinions Jon has today. And by that I mean Jon has his own reasons for not feeling particularly happy about T/rgaryens. Besides his family history, he’s also met one first hand, spent weeks (possibly months) as her prisoner, and seen what she’s like, what her dragons can do, how she treats the people around her, and what she prioritizes in life.

I’m under the impression that Jon thinks very little of Dænerys and sees her as a typical T/rgaryen. She takes what she wants with fire and blood and has little regard for how it affects others. There’s nothing about her he admires. And she does nothing to redeem her House or name or change the way the world views T/rgaryens.

Jon’s wanted to be a Stark his whole life. Learning that he’s a trueborn T/rgaryen will be devastating to him, and it wouldn’t surprise me if his first instinct is to reject the idea entirely.

Thanks for the ask!

body:
Dracarys

Dany: “Druh. Car. Yas.”

Jon: “Drah. Cah. Yahs.”

Dany (slightly agitated): “Druh. Car. Yas.”

Jon (even more agitated): “Drah. Cah. Yahs”

Dany (very agitated): “No, Jon say it like I’m saying it not how you’re saying it.”

Jon (Stannis level agitated): “Seven Hell’s I’m saying it like you’re saying it!”

*cut to Dany on Drogon flying in the air, the black dragon dives out of frame burning fire as she shouts “Dracarys” only to reveal Rhaegal was flying behind Drogon and it flies into frame with Jon riding him. “Dracarys” he yells as flame spills from the green dragon’s maw.*


(Do I want that as an ending to the trailer? Yes. Yes I do.)
